NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}]},"events":{"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"addTaskToCampaign(uint256,uint8,string,bytes,bool)":{"details":"Adds a task to an existing campaign. Can only be called by the campaign host in Draft status.","params":{"_campaignId":"The ID of the campaign.","_description":"A user-friendly description of the task.","_isOptional":"If true, this task is not mandatory for claiming.","_taskType":"The type of task (e.g., SOCIAL_FOLLOW).","_verificationData":"Data needed for verification (e.g., Twitter handle, encoded token data)."}},"claimReward(uint256)":{"details":"Allows a participant to claim their reward after completing all required tasks.","params":{"_campaignId":"The ID of the campaign."}},"closeCampaign(uint256)":{"details":"Closes the campaign, preventing further claims. Only accounts with HOST_ROLE can create campaigns.","params":{"_endTime":"The timestamp when the campaign officially ends.","_name":"The name of the campaign.","_startTime":"The timestamp when the campaign officially starts."},"returns":{"_0":"The ID of the newly created campaign."}},"endCampaign(uint256)":{"details":"Sets the campaign status to Ended. Can only be called by the host. This allows claims to begin.","params":{"_campaignId":"The ID of the campaign."}},"getCampaign(uint256)":{"details":"Retrieves campaign details.","params":{"_campaignId":"The ID of the campaign."},"returns":{"_0":"Campaign struct."}},"getCampaignCount()":{"details":"Returns the total number of campaigns created.","returns":{"_0":"The current value of _campaignCounter."}},"getCampaignTask(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Retrieves a specific task within a campaign.","params":{"_campaignId":"The ID of the campaign.","_taskIndex":"The index of the task."},"returns":{"_0":"CampaignTask struct."}},"getCampaignsByHost(address)":{"details":"Returns an array of campaign IDs created by a specific host.","params":{"_host":"The address of the host."},"returns":{"_0":"An array of uint256 representing campaign IDs."}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantHostRole(address)":{"details":"Grants the HOST_ROLE to an address, allowing them to create campaigns. Only callable by an account with DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE.","params":{"_account":"The address to grant the HOST_ROLE to."}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasClaimedReward(uint256,address)":{"details":"Checks if a participant has claimed the reward for a specific campaign.","params":{"_campaignId":"The ID of the campaign.","_participant":"The address of the participant."},"returns":{"_0":"True if claimed, false otherwise."}},"hasCompletedTask(uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"Checks if a participant has completed a specific task in a campaign.","params":{"_campaignId":"The ID of the campaign.","_participant":"The address of the participant.","_taskIndex":"The index of the task."},"returns":{"_0":"True if completed, false otherwise."}},"hasParticipated(uint256,address)":{"details":"Returns whether a participant has started participating in a campaign.","params":{"_campaignId":"The ID of the campaign.","_participant":"The address of the participant."},"returns":{"_0":"True if the participant has started, false otherwise."}},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"openCampaign(uint256)":{"details":"Sets the campaign status to Open. Can only be called by the host.","params":{"_campaignId":"The ID of the campaign."}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeHostRole(address)":{"details":"Revokes the HOST_ROLE from an address, preventing them from creating new campaigns. Only callable by an account with DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE.","params":{"_account":"The address to revoke the HOST_ROLE from."}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setCampaignReward(uint256,uint8,address,uint256)":{"details":"Sets the reward for a campaign. Can only be called by the campaign host in Draft status. For ERC20/ERC721, the host must approve/transfer tokens to this contract beforehand.","params":{"_amountOrTokenId":"The amount for ERC20, or specific token ID for ERC721_SINGLE.","_campaignId":"The ID of the campaign.","_rewardType":"The type of reward.","_tokenAddress":"The address of the ERC20/ERC721 token (if applicable)."}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."},"verifyTaskCompletion(uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"Allows the host to verify and mark an off-chain task as completed for a participant. This is crucial for off-chain tasks like social media follows.","params":{"_campaignId":"The ID of the campaign.","_participant":"The address of the participant.","_taskIndex":"The index of the task within the campaign's tasks 216d60a7e520d6f28319a255709cc407a5e48e70f0a951876","dweb:/ipfs/QmYJGmf1cin5YW7GJQTt5gFxBj9Ne2h2hpAyqXsTamJhED"]}},"version":1}

addTaskToCampaign(uint256,uint8,string,b.details: Adds a task to an existing campaign. Can only be called by the campaign host in Draft status.

params._description: A user-friendly description of the task.
params._isOptional: If true, this task is not mandatory for claiming.
params._verificationData: Data needed for verification (e.g., Twitter handle, encoded token data).

claimReward(uint256).details: Allows a participant to claim their reward after completing all required tasks.

closeCampaign(uint256).details: Closes the campaign, preventing further claims. Only callable by the host.

completeTask(uint256,uint256).details: Allows a participant to mark a task as completed. For off-chain tasks, this is a self-assertion that the host will later verify. For on-chain tasks, this function performs direct on-chain verification.

params._taskIndex: The index of the task within the campaign's tasks array.

createCampaign(string,uint256,uint256).details: Creates a new campaign in Draft status. Only accounts with HOST_ROLE can create campaigns.

params._endTime: The timestamp when the campaign officially ends.
params._startTime: The timestamp when the campaign officially starts.

returns._0: The ID of the newly created campaign.

endCampaign(uint256).details: Sets the campaign status to Ended. Can only be called by the host. This allows claims to begin.

getCampaignCount().details: Returns the total number of campaigns created.

getCampaignTask(uint256,uint256).details: Retrieves a specific task within a campaign.

getCampaignsByHost(address).details: Returns an array of campaign IDs created by a specific host.

returns._0: An array of uint256 representing campaign IDs.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantHostRole(address).details: Grants the HOST_ROLE to an address, allowing them to create campaigns. Only callable by an account with DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE.

params._account: The address to grant the HOST_ROLE to.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

hasClaimedReward(uint256,address).details: Checks if a participant has claimed the reward for a specific campaign.

hasCompletedTask(uint256,address,uint256.details: Checks if a participant has completed a specific task in a campaign.

hasParticipated(uint256,address).details: Returns whether a participant has started participating in a campaign.

returns._0: True if the participant has started, false otherwise.

openCampaign(uint256).details: Sets the campaign status to Open. Can only be called by the host.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeHostRole(address).details: Revokes the HOST_ROLE from an address, preventing them from creating new campaigns. Only callable by an account with DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE.

params._account: The address to revoke the HOST_ROLE from.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setCampaignReward(uint256,uint8,address,.details: Sets the reward for a campaign. Can only be called by the campaign host in Draft status. For ERC20/ERC721, the host must approve/transfer tokens to this contract beforehand.

params._amountOrTokenId: The amount for ERC20, or specific token ID for ERC721_SINGLE.
params._tokenAddress: The address of the ERC20/ERC721 token (if applicable).

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

verifyTaskCompletion(uint256,address,uin.details: Allows the host to verify and mark an off-chain task as completed for a participant. This is crucial for off-chain tasks like social media follows.

params._taskIndex: The index of the task within the campaign's tasks array.
